dataIdInfo.idPurp: Lake Superior National Estuarine Research Reserve Digital Polygon Boundary

idCitation.resTitle: Lake Superior National Estuarine Research Reserve Boundary

rpCntInfo.cntInstr: Contact LS NERR Staff for information

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.1.3497
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The LSNERR site is located on the southwestern coast of Lake Superior (Map 3) and contains approximately 16,697 acres of terrestrial (7,886 acres), wetland (4,136 acres), and aquatic (4,675 acres) habitats.

The Reserve consists of lands in public ownership and Wisconsin waters.

These areas, under four public entity ownerships, consist of the following components:

Red River Breaks (approximately 6,926 acres): The core area includes all adjacent islands and wetlands within the St. Louis River, the area of the St. Louis River within Wisconsin’s boundary, the uplands of the St. Louis and Red River Streambank Protection Area within one mile of the river’s shoreline, and the lands owned by Douglas County in Special Use designation. The buffer area is within the WDNR St. Louis and Red River Streambank Protection Area and located directly south of the core.

Pokegama-Carnegie Wetlands (approximately 226 acres): This entire component is buffer area and is a dedicated State Natural Area (SNA).

Pokegama Bay (approximately 6,723 acres): The core area is identified by the boundary of the Dwight’s Point and Pokegama Wetlands SNA within the Superior Municipal Forest (SMF) connecting waters of the St. Louis River upstream to the Red River Breaks, and areas owned by Douglas County and identified as Oliver Marsh. The buffer is the remaining areas within the SMF not identified as core areas.

Wisconsin Point (approximately 2,822acres): The core area consists of all land within the Reserve boundary on Wisconsin Point that is owned by the city of Superior and WDNR, areas adjacent to Allouez Bay owned by Douglas County, and water portions of Allouez Bay. The buffer area consists of Douglas County lands located on the Lake Superior shoreline, land surrounding Dutchman Creek that is owned by UWS, and Lake Superior waters bordering this component.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

rpCntInfo.cntInstr: Contact LS NERR staff for information

citeinfo.title: Lake Superior National Estuarine Research Reserve Digital Polygon Boundary

descript.purpose: The Reserve boundary was delineated based on management and research areas and is not meant to be a legal description of the Reserve.
descript.supplinf: This boundary is not to be taken as a legal definition of the NERR boundary. It was created based on management and research areas of the Reserve.
descript.abstract:
Lake Superior National Estuarine Research Reserve Digital Polygon Boundary was created as part of the National Estuarine Research Reserve system. The LKS NERR is made up of 4 component parts of various public lands; city, state, and university. The LSNERR site is located on the southwestern coast of Lake Superior (Map 3) and contains approximately 16,697 acres of terrestrial (7,886 acres), wetland (4,136 acres), and aquatic (4,675 acres) habitats.
The Reserve consists of lands in public ownership and Wisconsin waters.
These areas, under four public entity ownerships, consist of the following components:
Red River Breaks (approximately 6,926 acres): The core area includes all adjacent islands and wetlands within the St. Louis River, the area of the St. Louis River within Wisconsin’s boundary, the uplands of the St. Louis and Red River Streambank Protection Area within one mile of the river’s shoreline, and the lands owned by Douglas County in Special Use designation. The buffer area is within the WDNR St. Louis and Red River Streambank Protection Area and located directly south of the core.
Pokegama-Carnegie Wetlands (approximately 226 acres): This entire component is buffer area and is a dedicated State Natural Area (SNA).
Pokegama Bay (approximately 6,723 acres): The core area is identified by the boundary of the Dwight’s Point and Pokegama Wetlands SNA within the Superior Municipal Forest (SMF) connecting waters of the St. Louis River upstream to the Red River Breaks, and areas owned by Douglas County and identified as Oliver Marsh. The buffer is the remaining areas within the SMF not identified as core areas.
Wisconsin Point (approximately 2,822acres): The core area consists of all land within the Reserve boundary on Wisconsin Point that is owned by the city of Superior and WDNR, areas adjacent to Allouez Bay owned by Douglas County, and water portions of Allouez Bay. The buffer area consists of Douglas County lands located on the Lake Superior shoreline, land surrounding Dutchman Creek that is owned by UWS, and Lake Superior waters bordering this component.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.0.3348

attracc.attraccr: All attributes created during the editing process were verified by displaying the lines in both the database and the spatial coverage

dataqual.logic: These data are believed to be logically consistent, though no tests were performed. Polygon geometry is topologically clean.
dataqual.complete: The boundary of the Reserve is dependent on the shoreline and/or edges of rivers and bays as delineated on a USGS 7.5 minute Topographic Map. The edges or borders of the boundary might change as the natural land changes or better maps and aerial photography become available. The boundary was not based on legal parcels or definitions; therefore, the core boundary is a management/research boundary not a legal boundary. The edges or borders of the boundary might change as the natural land changes or better maps and aerial photography become available. Although parts of the boundary were based on legal parcels, boundaries along or through waterbodies are subject to the the digitizer's discretion and therefore, the core boundary is a management/research boundary not a legal boundary.

horizpa.horizpar: Positional accuracy varies since multiple sources were used to derive the line work. Sources include: (1) parcels from Douglas County, WI; (2) USGS 1:24,000 Topographic Maps (horizontal accuracy of 45.6 feet at the 95% confidence), primarily within the St. Louis River, and certain spots in Allouez Bay; (3) freehand digitizing to approximate locations was used to draw lines across Wisconsin Point, along the Wisconsin Breakwater, and in the open waters of Lake Superior.

vertacc.vertaccr: The data were delineated off a USGS 7.5 minute Topographic Map at 1:24000 scale. Therefore, the vertical accuracy is assumed to be within National Map Accuracy Standards, with a vertical accuracy of 11.9 feet at the 95% confidence level.

procstep.procdesc: Since no previous digital boundary existed for the Lake Superior NERR, one had to be created. Using the Douglas County Wisconsin Parcel layer with the ESRI online World Topo map (United States USGS 7.5 minute topographic map), in the projected coordinate System NAD_1983_HARN_Wisconsin_TM, a set of 4 polygon shapefiles were created by delineating the parcels with the adjacent water bodies, as needed. The polygon coverage was attributed according to the NOAA NERR standard and submitted to NOAA Coastal Services Center

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
